While debugging bazel failures, I found a race, which is fixed now by making the `pending_head` atomic. Nice thing is that the new implementation doesn't add any new field :-) and there are two non-relaxed atomic ops added. So, I would expect the new version to be faster than the previous commit :-)

The windows failure was a legitimate failure. Apparently VC++ doesn't allow boolean operation on std::atomic<ptr>, and it caught the error in `request_matcher_zombify_all_pending_calls` 

I converted them all to `load(order_relaxed)`. sorry about that.
